title: Easy Steps to Turn Off Read Receipts on Android

steps.title: Open Messages by Google on your Android.
steps.content: Open Messages by Google on your Android. Tap the app icon that looks like blue overlapping speech bubbles on a white background.

steps.title: Tap your profile icon.
steps.content: Tap your profile icon. It's in the top right corner of your screen and will prompt a menu to open.

steps.title: Tap Message Settings.
steps.content: Tap Message Settings . You'll see this near the bottom of the menu next to a gear icon.

steps.title: Tap RCS chats.
steps.content: Tap RCS chats . It's the first item on the menu.

steps.title: Tap the toggle next to "Send read receipts" to toggle it off .
steps.content: Tap the toggle next to "Send read receipts" to toggle it off . As long as the toggle is grey and pointing to the left, it's off. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open Samsung Messages.
steps.content: Open Samsung Messages. Tap the blue speech bubble icon with three dots in the middle. Samsung Messages is the default text messaging app on all Samsung Galaxy phones. Use this method if you haven't installed Messages by Google.

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . You'll see this three-dot menu icon centered on the right side of your screen.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It's at the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Tap Advanced Messaging.
steps.content: Tap Advanced Messaging . It's the first item on the menu.

steps.title: Tap the toggle next to "Share read status" to turn it off .
steps.content: Tap the toggle next to "Share read status" to turn it off . If the switch is grey and pointing to the left, the feature is off. [2] X Research source
